decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures and burn spells to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. With a low mana curve and a high number of creatures with haste, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent early in the game. The inclusion of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast provides additional reach to finish off the opponent even if they stabilize the board. The use of artifacts like Inventor's Axe and Clockwork Percussionist adds additional utility and damage potential to the deck.

This Mono Blue Aggro deck focuses on quickly casting low-cost creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tolarian Terror, while also utilizing cheap spells and cantrips to maintain pressure on the opponent. Cryptic Serpent provides a big threat later in the game, while counterspells like Counterspell and Dispel protect your board. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient spells and creatures, while maintaining a strong card advantage with cards like Thought Scour and Brainstorm. The deck is built around tempo and efficiency, aiming to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in the early game.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's strategy through countering spells, removal, and card draw. Using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw, the deck aims to gain card advantage and control the pace of the game. The inclusion of threats like Gurmag Angler and Murmuring Mystic provides a win condition while the mana base of Islands and dual lands ensures smooth mana production for the deck's spells. The deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver opponents through careful resource management and strategic decision-making.

The focus of this deck is to disrupt and control the opponent while utilizing low-cost spells to quickly access powerful creatures like Cryptic Serpent and Murmuring Mystic. With a heavy emphasis on card draw and manipulation, the deck aims to consistently have answers to threats and maintain a strong board presence. Using a combination of counterspells, card draw, and efficient creatures, the Mono Blue Terror deck looks to outlast the opponent and secure victory through careful planning and calculated decision-making.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of elvish creatures and generate massive amounts of mana through cards like Priest of Titania and Llanowar Elves. Lead the Stampede and Winding Way help dig through the deck to find more creatures while Timberwatch Elf boosts their power. The deck also includes some removal and lifegain options with Masked Vandal and Wellwisher. The goal is to quickly build a strong board presence and leverage the synergy between the elves to outpace and overpower the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to rapidly deal damage to the opponent through a combination of direct burn spells and aggressive creatures. The strategy involves using cheap and efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Fireblast to target both the opponent's life total and their creatures, while also deploying aggressive creatures like Kessig Flamebreather and Voldaren Epicure to maintain pressure on the opponent. Additional cards like Sneaky Snacker and Guttersnipe provide additional value and reach. The goal is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with direct damage and creature threats.

This aggro deck focuses on efficiently deploying creatures like Kor Skyfisher and Glint Hawk to quickly apply pressure to the opponent. It combines cheap removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast with value generating cards like Novice Inspector and Relic of Progenitus to maintain card advantage and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes some lifegain lands to help stabilize against aggressive decks. Overall, the strategy revolves around tempo plays and leveraging the synergy between cheap creatures and efficient removal spells to overwhelm the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly generate poison counters on the opponent while also storming off with cheap spells and mana rocks. The deck utilizes cards like Infectious Inquiry and LÃ³rien Revealed to poison the opponent, while also using cards like Snap and Contentious Plan to draw cards and keep the combo going. With plenty of ways to generate extra mana and pump up storm count, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a lethal combination of poison and storm spells.

The deck focuses on quickly dropping artifact creatures and generating value through sacrificing artifacts to deal damage. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures while also having removal options and card draw to maintain momentum. The deck's synergy lies in the combination of artifact creatures, artifact lands, and sacrifice effects to create a fast and aggressive playstyle. The strategy revolves around utilizing the affinity mechanic to reduce the cost of artifact spells and maximize the deck's explosiveness.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of aggressive Elf creatures. By quickly ramping up mana with cards like Priest of Titania and Llanowar Elves, the deck aims to play multiple threats early on and maintain card advantage with Lead the Stampede and Winding Way. Cards like Timberwatch Elf and Nyxborn Hydra can quickly close out games with their powerful abilities, while Generous Ent and Wellwisher help keep the player alive against aggressive opponents. This deck aims to win through fast, efficient creature-based combat.

This Jund aggro deck focuses on sacrificing and recurring creatures and artifacts to gain card advantage and control the board. The deck uses cards like Cleansing Wildfire and Drossforge Bridge to disrupt opponents' lands, while cards like Refurbished Familiar and Ichor Wellspring provide value through sacrificing and drawing cards. Fanatical Offering and Lembas allow for sacrificing creatures for additional benefits, while Krark-Clan Shaman and Writhing Chrysalis provide removal and pressure. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggression and resource advantage.

This deck focuses on using artifacts to fuel aggressive plays and overwhelm the opponent with threats. By utilizing cheap artifacts like Myr Enforcer and Drossforge Bridge, the deck can quickly build a board presence and pressure the opponent. Additionally, cards like Galvanic Blast provide direct burn damage to finish off the opponent. With an emphasis on sacrificing artifacts for value and generating card advantage through cards like Thoughtcast, the deck aims to maintain a steady stream of threats while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting opponents with counterspells and removal, while utilizing card draw and creatures with flash to maintain card advantage and board control. The deck includes efficient removal spells like Snuff Out and Cast Down, as well as powerful control cards like Counterspell and Brainstorm. The deck also includes evasive threats like Spellstutter Sprite and Gurmag Angler to pressure opponents. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and provide flexibility in casting spells.

The main focus of this deck is to efficiently deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible through a combination of burn spells and aggressive creatures. By maximizing the use of cards like Lightning Bolt, Lava Dart, and Fiery Temper, along with creatures like Guttersnipe and Kessig Flamebreather, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. The inclusion of cards like Faithless Looting and Highway Robbery help maintain hand advantage and provide additional reach for finishing off the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card draw while utilizing snow-covered lands for additional benefits. The deck focuses on utilizing faeries as cheap creatures with disruptive abilities, along with the versatility of red spells for removal and burn. The inclusion of cards like Augur of Bolas and Brainstorm allows for consistency and card advantage, while also being able to maintain control through countermagic and removal spells. The goal is to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent until victory is achieved.

This Rakdos aggro deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents with a combination of burn spells, cheap creatures, and lifegain. By playing aggressive creatures like Kitchen Imp and Voldaren Epicure, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Fiery Temper, the deck puts pressure on the opponent early on. Alms of the Vein and Vampire's Kiss provide lifegain to sustain the aggression, while Grab the Prize and Highway Robbery offer additional ways to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Rakdos Aggro is focused on quick, efficient damage output to win the game swiftly.
